definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to astonish people (with a miraculous feat)

sentences.english: MBL's work is truly amazing, thank you for letting me be a part of it.
sentences.chinese: MBL的工作确实是惊人的，谢谢你让我成为一部分。

sentences.english: Hit with a critical and your looking incredible damage done.
sentences.chinese: 等着看你惊人的暴击伤害吧。

sentences.english: The stirring event was well canvassed.
sentences.chinese: 那桩惊人的事情已经是满城风雨。

sentences.english: Critics argue this stunt is hostile to the Catholic Church.
sentences.chinese: 批语家指出这样的惊人表演是对天主教堂的不敬重。

sentences.english: There are striking resemblances between the twin brothers.
sentences.chinese: 双胞胎的长相有惊人的相似之处。

sentences.english: If threatened, the colo will lash out with amazing speed.
sentences.chinese: 在受到威胁时，寇罗爪鱼会以惊人的速度发出猛击。

sentences.english: "That's a very big number, " Chen said.
sentences.chinese: 陈表示说“那是一个十分惊人的数据。”

sentences.english: Perec was a frighteningly clever writer.
sentences.chinese: 佩里克是一个才智惊人的作家。

sentences.english: Male models can use fade turns in combination to create a stunning runway walk.
sentences.chinese: 男模特可以使用淡入组合来创造一个惊人的跑道走。

sentences.english: A staggering percentage of America's adults are unequipped for life in a modern society.
sentences.chinese: 美国成年人中无法适应现代社会生活的比例高得惊人。

sentences.english: He has carefully planted the surprise word.
sentences.chinese: 他已经事先准备好惊人之语了。

sentences.english: Wages have gone up tremendously over the past years.
sentences.chinese: 薪水在过去的几年里以惊人的速度增长。

sentences.english: People also enjoy Garfield's outrageous6 sense of humor.
sentences.chinese: 人们同时也喜欢加菲猫语不惊人死不休的幽默感。

sentences.english: The form of this table is just striking.
sentences.chinese: 这个桌子的形状是非常惊人的。

sentences.english: The number of volunteers assisting those people living in the earthquake-hit area is surprising.
sentences.chinese: 正在帮助那些地震灾区的人们的志愿者人数大得惊人。

definition: Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
to be in defiance of the natural order
out of the ordinary/unusually (good, talented etc)
